subject: Art & Design
title: Brand Architecture: Managing Multiple Brands
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Brand Architecture: Managing Multiple Brands.

hook.text: Google, YouTube, and Waymo look nothing alike. But they're all Alphabet. How do you design a family of brands?

buildup.text: Brand architecture defines how brands within a company relate: monolithic (Google), endorsed (Marriott).

discovery.text: Monolithic: one brand everywhere (Virgin). Endorsed: parent backs sub-brands (Courtyard by Marriott).

twist.text: There's no 'best' structure. It depends on whether the parent brand helps or hurts the sub-brand's credibility.

climax.text: Apple uses monolithic (iPhone, iPad, Mac). Each sub-brand inherits Apple's trust.

quiz.question: What is a 'monolithic' brand architecture?
options: One master brand used across all products and services
Multiple independent brands with no visible parent
A parent brand that endorses each sub-brand separately
